intro: Codonoboea, commonly known as the African bellflower, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Acanthaceae. Codonoboea species typically grow as shrubs or herbs, often with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. They thrive in well-drained soils and are adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. The genus includes several species, some of which are cultivated for their ornamental value in gardens.
